questions.question: How does the backoff mechanism in CSMA/CA help in avoiding collisions?

answers.a: It forces all devices to wait for the same time before transmission
answers.b: It introduces a random delay before retransmission
answers.c: It immediately retries transmission after a failed attempt

explanations.a: Incorrect! If all devices wait the same time, collisions can still occur.
explanations.b: Correct! The random backoff reduces the chance of simultaneous retransmissions.
explanations.c: Incorrect! Immediate retries increase the risk of collisions.
explanations.d: Incorrect! RTS/CTS helps with the hidden node problem, not the backoff mechanism.

questions.question: What does the Clear-to-Send (CTS) signal indicate in CSMA/CA?

answers.a: The channel is free for any device to transmit
answers.b: The sender can now transmit data

explanations.a: Incorrect! CTS is only sent to a specific sender, not to all devices.
explanations.b: Correct! CTS informs the sender that it has reserved the channel and can transmit.
explanations.c: Incorrect! CSMA/CA aims to avoid collisions rather than detect them.
explanations.d: Incorrect! CTS does not indicate transmission failure.

questions.question: What happens when a device detects that the channel is busy in CSMA/CA?

answers.b: It waits for an ACK signal
answers.c: It defers transmission and starts a backoff timer

explanations.a: Incorrect! Transmitting on a busy channel increases collision probability.
explanations.b: Incorrect! The device has not yet transmitted, so an ACK is irrelevant.
explanations.c: Correct! CSMA/CA defers transmission and initiates a backoff timer.
explanations.d: Incorrect! Increasing power does not resolve contention issues.

questions.question: If two devices transmit at the same time despite CSMA/CA, what happens?

answers.a: The transmission is successful for both devices
answers.c: Packets may collide and require retransmission

explanations.a: Incorrect! Simultaneous transmission leads to packet collisions.
explanations.b: Incorrect! If a collision occurs, neither device receives an ACK.
explanations.c: Correct! Collided packets are lost and need retransmission.
explanations.d: Incorrect! Devices do not shut down due to collisions.

questions.question: How does CSMA/CA handle the hidden node problem?

answers.a: By using RTS/CTS before transmitting data

explanations.a: Correct! RTS/CTS helps coordinate transmissions and avoid hidden node issues.
explanations.b: Incorrect! Simultaneous transmissions can cause collisions.
explanations.c: Incorrect! Increasing power does not resolve the hidden node problem.
explanations.d: Incorrect! CSMA/CD is ineffective in wireless networks.
